@borisstoyanov : Following are the steps for reproducing this issue : 

1. Deploy a vm to a VPC having more than one tier, selecting one of the tier .
2. Attach the second tier to the VM as second NIC.
3. Remove all lease files from the VM from location /var/lib/dhclient/
4. Stop and start the VM or restart the network service to retrieve the IP addresses from DHCP server.

Hope above steps will help you to reproduce the issue.
